item.title: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:9, topic:397783”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=494915.msg3618512#msg3618512 date=1307198776]
TBH, if i could buy an iPhone AND an iPad just for selling a kidney that I’ve got 2 of, I’d probably do it.
[/quote]
This.

I have two. Only need one.[/quote]

At work we discussed organ donation the other day. I’m one of the youngest employees, but perfectly understood the reasoning of the older employees, who have children. If you only have one of two organs left, you can survive. So you’d think that you could sell one and earn a lot of money, fast. But what if one of your children gets sick, and needs a donor kidney fast? What if your wife isn’t a match, only you are? In that case, you either hope there’s another donor, or you sacrifice yourself for your child.

Read full topic
item.source: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'

item.title: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

spank:

If your gonna do it atleast buy somthing worth your while

Yea, he could have at least gotten an Android phone and Android Tablet for part of his body.

But I’d have to say this has absolutely nothing to do with religion, it’s a stupid move no matter what your religious disposition.

item.title: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:9, topic:397783”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=494915.msg3618512#msg3618512 date=1307198776]
TBH, if i could buy an iPhone AND an iPad just for selling a kidney that I’ve got 2 of, I’d probably do it.
[/quote]
This.

I have two. Only need one.[/quote]

Too stupid to realise there’s a reason for having two?

We have 2 lungs, 2 hands, 2 arms, 2 legs, 2 eyes, 2 balls, etc etc

Selling body parts for material objects is the dumbest thing I ever heard.

Read full topic

item.title: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Radeon:

If he believed in religion, and I say that very lightly because it does indeed depend on which religion, I’d like to think he would have behaved otherwise.

This is merely an extreme example of todays society, where consumption and “keeping up with the Joneses” is more important that rational thinking. An atheist doesn’t do something like this, as an atheist understands the value of his own body, and that this life is the only life he has.

Radeon:

That being said, there wasn’t anything in the link to indicate whether he believed in religion or not.

I don’t know the numbers, but religion is accepted in China. Times have changed, state atheism is abandoned.

Read full topic
item.source: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'

item.title: Chinese teenager 'sells kidney to buy iPad and iPhone'
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:3, topic:397783”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=494915.msg3618399#msg3618399 date=1307188531]
I don’t see a link between selling your kidney to buy something, and a lack of religion.
[/quote]

It was an impulse decision when I typed that but after thinking about it, I can see a link. The teenager probably didn’t know the consequences of selling his kidney or he didn’t know the full implications thereof. If he believed in religion, and I say that very lightly because it does indeed depend on which religion, I’d like to think he would have behaved otherwise. That being said, there wasn’t anything in the link to indicate whether he believed in religion or not.[/quote]

It has little to do with religion. It is more a lack of intelligence. You don’t need religion to tell you that getting rid of part of your body for a luxury product is silly, especially when it could prove useful in the future.

Then again, maybe he was religious, it seems to go well with lack of intelligence.

Read full topic

BBC News

Chinese teen 'sells kidney for iPad'

A 17-year-old Chinese boy has sold one of his kidneys in order to buy an iPhone and iPad, according to local media reports.

Lack of religion?

inb4 yakman.
